title: JAM Session _1461 Activity Tracking  A Start.pdf

pageContent: © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Presented by Claire Mand & Hollie McCrea Olson  Edgewood College  June 2, 2016  Activity Tracking: A Start © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Official record of learning     Recognized and valued by employers and other institutions as proof of qualifications     Can provide an at-a-glance preview of who a person is and where their passions and skills lie     But what is missing . . . ?  Transcripts: Why are they valuable? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Organization and club participation     Global studies experiences     Civic engagement activities     Outside internships and practicums  Co-curricular transcripts   offer institutional recognition and credibility to some of these experiences, but they must be tracked in an organized and reliable way.  Experiences and Learning Outside of the Classroom © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Tracks, quantifies, and validates work students do outside of the classroom     Validates work that Student Affairs professionals do to educate students     Provides quantitative data for grant proposals, defending budgets, Higher Learning Commission audits, etc.  Our Goal  To give you the basics of how to set up & start activity tracking on your campus  Why is Activity Tracking Important? © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Setting the Stage     Edgewood College has begun activity tracking in EX through a pilot program with Dominican Life (College Ministries)     Previously, Dominican Life activities were tracked in an Access database  •   Pulling reports became cumbersome  •   Duplicate data was collected and entered  •   Lots of room for error  •   Limited to the data collected by Dominican Life  •   Staff knew that other data, including biographical data was collected by the college during the admissions process etc. but couldn’t access this data for reporting     Module Manager was contacted to explore possibilities © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Activity Tracking was a clear home for this data     For years, we’ve been wanting to utilize the functionality     Obstacle: Can’t report on data that isn’t entered in to the database!     Solution: People power to enter the data  •   Utilizing student worker resource, IT background     Requested the appropriate level of access to EX so the student worker and administrative assistant could work independently in both EX and Infomaker  Getting Started © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Overview  Add activities  Define Activity Type  Add participants  Define Participation Type  Add dates and times  Indicate attendees  Define Events © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Student Life module is organized by session (ex. Fall 2016)  •   We chose to enter a small subset of data from the previous semester to track initially     Took data from the existing Access database report and entered attendance from a small number of activities     This allowed further configuration before we relied solely on Jenzabar. Entering the data was assigned to a staff member. From there our student worker majoring in IT worked to create reports that would pull the data out in a way that was useful and reflective of the previous Access reports.  Getting Started © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Functionality exists in the Student Life Module  Home for Activity Tracking in EX © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Configure Jenzabar  Define a new activity type  Laying the Foundation © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Define activity definitions  Laying the Foundation © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Session Activities  Before you can record any data you have to set up the Session Activities.  Click on the   Session Activities   link on your main home page.  Add the activities for that semester from the drop down menu using the activities that were earlier defined in the   Activity Definition .  Adding Activities to a Session © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     You must then define the participation level  Participation Definition © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Activity Participation  To add participants to an activity, click on   Session Activities  Adding Activity Participants © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Adding Activity Participants (cont.)  Right click on the activity you want to add participants to and click   Activity Participation © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     The   Activity Participation   window will pop up. To add participants, in the ID Number column, on the first row, click on the drop down menu arrow.     Type the participant’s   ID#   then select the name from the drop down menu.  Adding Activity Participants (cont.) © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Check the   Track Attendance   box and choose the participation level (we used “PARTI” for participant)     You will need to do this for all of the participants in that activity  Adding Activity Participants (cont.) © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Before recording attendance for an event make sure the status column under the  Meeting History   pop up says “Has Not Met.”  To access   Meeting History  Setting Up to Record Attendance  Select  Session Activities  Right click on event  Select  Meeting History © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     To record attendance, go to   Session Activities . Right Click on the activity you are working on and choose   Meeting History   from the dropdown     Type in meeting start and end date and times  To record attendance © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Right click on the row and choose   Record Attendance .     Click the   Load Participants   button and use the check boxes to indicate attendees.  To record attendance (cont.)  NOTE: If the list is empty, double check that the status of the event is, “Has Not Met”! © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     At Edgewood, we use Infomaker to report on the data     Our Dominican Life student worker created queries that reported the necessary data for end of year reports, etc.  Data is now in, how to get it back out! © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Create queries  Pull the data back out © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Act_part     Name_master     Act_club_def     Mtg_attend_hst     Stud_attend_sum     Biograph_master  Main tables utilized in reporting from Activity Tracking © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Reporting off biograph master-needed to be done in aggregate only     Utilized Infomaker query and Excel to create an aggregate report  Sticky Point: Biograph Master-data reported in aggregate only © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     Excel helps with aggregate data, though could be done through Informaker report as well  Biograph Master-data reported in aggregate only © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort     This is the tip of the iceberg for activity tracking!     Civic Engagement Coordinating Council is interested in exploring the next steps     Creates enable reporting where our students are engaged in our community  •   Pulling data for grants  •   Carnegie Community Engagement classification     Opens the door for certificates, such as a Leadership Certificate, Civic Engagement Certificate etc.     End goal:  •   Students can graduate from Edgewood with an official record of their outside engagement validated by a Co-Curricular Transcript  Where do we go from here . . . © 2016 Jenzabar, Inc.   June 1 - 4, 2016 Gaylord Texan Resort  Thank you for coming!  Claire Mand, Director of Residence Life,   cmand@edgewood.edu  Hollie McCrea Olson, Area Director,   hmccreaolson@edgewood.edu  Questions?
